The `clean_up()` function will be used when data is imported to remove common 
issues and prevent
```{r}
clean_string <- function(x) {
  x %>% 
    trimws() %>% 
    tolower() %>% 
    stringr::str_replace_all("\\s+", " ") %>% 
    stringr::str_replace_all(" ", "_") %>%  
    if_else(. == "", as.character(NA), .)
}
```


```{r}
clean_up <- function(x) {
  x %>% 
    rename_all(clean_string) %>% 
    mutate_if(is.character, clean_string) %>% 
    distinct()
}
```
